material.mattext: State the p-value, and draw your conclusions in context.

Using the Excel function NORMSDIST(-1.97), we find that the p-value is .024. At the .05 significance level, this p-value is small enough to indicate that the results are significant. In other words, the data provide enough evidence to reject Ho and conclude that the mean pregnancy length of women who smoke and/or drink alcohol during pregnancy is smaller than the mean pregnancy length of women in general.
